intro: Mimosa catechu, commonly known as the Indian mimosa, is a deciduous shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its feathery, bipinnate leaves that fold when touched. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, followed by pods that contain edible seeds. It is well-known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it an important plant in ecological restoration. Additionally, its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their astringent properties.
